h:head.h:title: OSCE_CHECKLIST FOR BLOOD TEST FOR HEMOGLOBIN

select1.label: GETTING READY Prepare the necessary equipment - -A pair of gloves -Spirit swabs -Lancet -N/10 HCL -Distilled water -Dropper -Haemoglobinometer with a comparator on both sides -Pipette and stirrer -Hemoglobin tube (Sahli-Adams Tube) It is graduated on one side in g% from 2 to 24g% and on the other side in percentage from 20% to 40%
GETTING READY Explain the purpose of the hemoglobin test to the woman and encourage her to ask questions.
GETTING READY Wash hands thoroughly with soap and water and dry with clean dry cloth or allow to air dry.
GETTING READY Put new examination or high-level disinfected gloves on both hands.
GETTING READY Fill the Hb tube with N/10 HCl Upto 20% or 2g% with the dropper
HEMOGLOBIN TEST (Using Haemoglobinometer) Clean the tip of the woman's index finger with an alcohol swab.
HEMOGLOBIN TEST (Using Haemoglobinometer) Prick finger using lancet and discard first drop of blood.

HEMOGLOBIN TEST (Using Haemoglobinometer) Allow a large drop of blood to form on the fingertip. Dip the tip of the Hb pipette into the blood drop and suck blood up to the 20 cmm mark on the pipette. Do not squeeze finger tip to collect blood. While sucking the blood, care should be taken to prevent entry of air.
HEMOGLOBIN TEST (Using Haemoglobinometer) Wipe the tip of the pipette with cotton. Immediately transfer the 20 cmm (0.02ml) of blood from the pipette into the Hb tube containing N/10 HCL
HEMOGLOBIN TEST (Using Haemoglobinometer) Rinse the pipette two to three times by drawing up and blowing out the acid solution
HEMOGLOBIN TEST (Using Haemoglobinometer) Leave the solution in the tube for about 10 minutes (for conversion of Hb into hematin)
HEMOGLOBIN TEST (Using Haemoglobinometer) After 10 minutes, dilute the acid by adding distilled water drop by drop. Mix it with stirrer.

HEMOGLOBIN TEST (Using Haemoglobinometer) Note down the reading (lower meniscus) when the colour of the solution exactly matches that of the comparator on both sides of the hemoglobinometer. This expresses the Hb content as g%.

POST-TEST TASKS
Dispose of pipette or capillary tube and lancet in puncture proof container
POST-TEST TASKS Immerse both gloved hands in 0.5% chlorine solution: -Remove gloves by turning them inside out -If disposing of gloves, place in leak proof container or plastic bag.

POST-TEST TASKS
Rinse the pipette and Hb tube, two or three times by drawing up and blowing out the acid solution.

POST-TEST TASKS
Discuss the results of the test with the woman: -If hemoglobin is less than 7 g/dL, refer the woman for treatment If hemoglobin is 7-11 g/dL prescribe iron/folate one tablet daily and provide nutrition counseling
POST-TEST TASKS Record test results on the woman's record
